alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 3:07AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM HST THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County. * WHEN...Until 615 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 302 AM HST, radar indicated moderate to locally heavy rain over the Kau district, with additional areas of rain offshore that will move ashore over the Puna and south Hilo districts. With rain falling at a maximum rate of 1 inch per hour, significant flooding is not expected, but ponding will occur in low-lying areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hilo, Hawaiian Paradise Park, Hawaii Volcanoes National Park, Volcano, Glenwood, Mountain View, Hawaiian Acres, Wood Valley, Orchidland Estates, Pahala, Keaau, Pahoa, Punaluu Beach, Kawa Flats, Papaikou, Pepeekeo, Naalehu, Fern Forest and Eden Roc. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 615 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Rainfall and runoff will also cause hazardous driving conditions due to ponding, reduced visibility and poor braking action. A Flood Watch is also in effect.
